musixmatch.py
code:
from requests import get
from urllib.parse import quote
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup # pip install bs4 | pip3 install bs4

def musixmatch(QUERY : str):
    xhr_header = {"User-Agent" : "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/101.0.4951.64 Safari/537.36 Edg/101.0.1210.47"}
    url = BeautifulSoup(get(f"https://www.google.com/search?q=site%3Amusixmatch.com%20{quote(QUERY)}&num=1", headers=xhr_header).text, "html.parser").find("div", attrs={"class" : "yuRUbf"}).find("a").get("href")
    res = ""
    for i in BeautifulSoup(get(url, headers=xhr_header).text, "html.parser").findAll("span", attrs={"class" : "lyrics__content__ok"}):res += i.text
    return res

name: WebView.py
code:
# pip install PyQt6 PyQt6-WebEngine

from PyQt6.QtWidgets import QApplication
from PyQt6.QtWebEngineWidgets import QWebEngineView
from PyQt6.QtCore import QUrl
from sys import argv

class Browser(QWebEngineView):
    def __init__(self, url : str) -> None:
        super().__init__()
        self.setGeometry(50, 50, 1000, 600)
      self.setUrl(QUrl(url))
        self.titleChanged.connect(lambda : self.setWindowTitle(self.title()))
        self.iconChanged.connect(lambda : self.setWindowIcon(self.icon()))
        self.page().profile().setHttpUserAgent("Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:98.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/98.0")
        self.show()

app = QApplication(argv)
ex = Browser("https://www.google.com/")
app.exec()
